availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Sydney S. Dunbar (Adair County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Litticia F. Dunbar. Father of William P. Dunbar, John C. Dunbar, Thomas P. Dunbar, Gustavus A. Dunbar, Frances L. Dunbar, Marietta Dunbar, Louantha Dunbar, and O. Dunbar. Farmer in Adair County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Adair County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Division 2, p. 17.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Columbia, p. 9A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Division 2, p. 10A.
Find A Grave, "Sydney Smith Dunbar (1808-1889)," Memorial #37297380, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/37297380 (accessed June 13, 2020).
